Title: U.S. Census Bureau OnTheMap
Detailed Description of Data: Data provided by the U.S. Census Bureau allows users to select cities and counties. This data from the Census Bureua allows a user do get an idea of the average distance the population of Santa Clara County lives relative to their work and vice versa. Sample data from this location shows 48% of the population in Santa Clara County lives less than 10 miles from their place of work. Filters are available such as age-range/salary range/etc.
Description of How Data Was Collected: This data was collected from the OnTheMap application provided by the U.S. Census Bureau

Title: Major Employers in Santa Clara
Detailed Description of Data: Data list of major employers in Santa Clara County. This data from EDD give information about the location and industry of each company. The locations provide an idea of where people commute to work
Description of How Data Was Collected: The list of major employers was extracted from the America's Labor Market Information System (ALMIS) Employer Database 2016

Title: Means of Transportation to Work for Workers 16 years and over
Detailed Description of Data: The data displays usage percentage of various ways of transportation
Description of How Data Was Collected: Data was collected from 2010 Census

Title: Public Datasets related to Transportation
Detailed Description of Data: Datasets varies from commute mode choice to patterns and time. Users can find information about daily miles travel and of which how many miles traveled in congestion. The data center also include traffic volumes at regional gateways and transit system efficieny data record.
Description of How Data Was Collected: The data for each Vital Signs measure comes from a variety of national state and regional data sources. These data have been collected processed and combined so that they can be easily visualized and downloaded.

Agency: CTOD Center For Transit Oriented Development
Title: TOD Database San Francisco
Detailed Description of Data: Data provided in the TOD Database allows user to select region and transit such as Bart/Caltrain/VTA etc. This data allows a user to choose specific station to find out percentage of each transportation service used
Description of How Data Was Collected: This data was collected from nationally available data sets including the 2000 and 2010 Decennial Census.

Title: Santa Clara County Demographic and Employment Trends
Detailed Description of Data: Several graphs display the population count by cities in Santa Clara county predicted population growths in each city in the county up to 2030 and a population relative to student enrollement in De Anza and Foothill college. This data is helpful to our project because it displays the where students live by city and how many of them go to school.
Description of How Data Was Collected: This data was gathered by a Grad Student from UC Berkeley and his sources are from the Department of Finance from the State of California

Title: Commuting Characteristics By Sex 2015 American Community Survey Estimates
Detailed Description of Data: This data represents a graph of the Santa Clara’s percentage of how people are getting to work/travel time to work/number of vehicles available. The most common way to getting to work was driving at 75.7 percent. 12.8 percent of people worked outside the county. It was the most common for people to commute from 30 to 40 minutes Public
Description of How Data Was Collected: Data was collected from the American Community Survey (ACS)

Title: 2013 Santa Clara County Employee Commute Survey
Detailed Description of Data: The purpose of the survey was to observe Santa Clara County's employees commute patterns to work. The survey gathered data such as reason why people do not use public transportation. SSC offers many alternatives tranportation programs to try and diminish the amount of employees driving solo. 33 percent of employees are interested in learning more information about public transporation. This data is useful to our project because it shows the commute patterns of many employees of SSC.
Description of How Data Was Collected: This PDF is downloaded from the SCC's Facilities and Fleet Department.

Title: Global Uber Statistics
Detailed Description of Data: The data from this page shows that the zip code with the third most requests is 95110..which is downtown san jose and only falls behind LA and SF. This could tell us that people are more willing and able to use an uber (probably late at night) than catch a VTA because VTAs don't run that late
Description of How Data Was Collected: I believe the data is pulled from uber's database

Title: Data USA: Santa Clara County
Detailed Description of Data: Right off the bat the data presented at a first glance tells us that the median income in the santa clara county is almost $100k and the median age is 37. People often look at public transportation as a way for lower-income people to get around and almost everyone that makes over $40k a year owns a vehicle because parking in Santa Clara county is nowhere near compareable to places like San Francisco. There are also graphs maps/charts that break down each area's annual income so it might help VTA figure out if they should build in lower-income areas
Description of How Data Was Collected: The income data was collected by the US Census with the maps created by Carto and OpenStreetMap

Agency: Santa Clara County Facilities and Fleet Department
Title: Santa Clara County 2011 Employee Commute Survey Analysis
Detailed Description of Data: Survey tries to understand transportation patterns of employees in Santa Clara County in 2011 in relation to age gender and geographical distribution
Description of How Data Was Collected: The PDF is downloaded from the SCC’s Facilities and Fleet Department

Title: Bay Area Bike Share - Open Data
Detailed Description of Data: The data include information about each trip. Informations like bike number trip time trip start/end stations rider type and weather information
Description of How Data Was Collected: These data are recorded internally by Bay Area Bike Share

Agency: United States Department of Transportation - Office of the Assistant Secretary for Research and Technology
Title: The Intermodel Transportation Database
Detailed Description of Data: The Intermodal Transportation Database includes information on the volumes of freight and passenger movement by mode origin and destinations; location and connectivity of transportation facilities; and a national accounting of expenditures and capital stocks on each mode of transportation and intermodal combination.
Description of How Data Was Collected: Volumes of freight movement are collected in the Commodity Flow Survey the Transborder Freight Data Program and other sources. Freight movement is also compiled in the Freight Analysis Framework. Volumes of passenger movement are collected through the National Household  Travel Survey airline origins and destinations from a sample of tickets and the American Travel Survey. Location and connectivity of transportation facilities are highlighted by the Intermodal Passenger Connectivity Database. Transportation expenditures and capital stocks are highlighted in National Transportation Statistics publication.

Title: West San Jose Profile 2016
Detailed Description of Data: This source presents a demographic snapshot of West San Jose the more relevant information from this source is the population size and its transportation options
Description of How Data Was Collected: data was collected from U.S. Census Bureau and the 2010-2014 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates

Title: Santa Clara – Southeast profile 2016
Detailed Description of Data: This source presents a demographic snapshot of Southeast Santa Clara. The more relevant information from this source is the population size and its transportation options
Description of How Data Was Collected: data was collected from U.S. Census Bureau and the 2010-2014 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates

Description of How Data Was Collected: data was collected from U.S. Census Bureau and the 2010-2014 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates

Title: Gilroy profile 2016
Detailed Description of Data: This source presents a demographic snapshot of GIlroy. The more relevant information from this source is the population size and its transportation options
Description of How Data Was Collected: data was collected from U.S. Census Bureau and the 2010-2014 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates

Title: Los Gatos Data USA
Detailed Description of Data: This sites provides valuable data of economy demographics education housing & living and health and safety. In hoursing and living it even specifies to taxes rent cars ownership commute time and commute transportation. It can allow us to pinpoint data from these cities and get detailed results
Description of How Data Was Collected: Data is collected from U.S Census and Amercan Community Survey

Detailed Description of Data: This sites provides valuable data of economy demographics education housing & living and health and safety. In hoursing and living it even specifies to taxes rent cars ownership commute time and commute transportation. It can allow us to pinpoint data from these cities and get detailed results
Description of How Data Was Collected: Data is collected from U.S Census and Amercan Community Survey

Detailed Description of Data: This sites provides valuable data of economy demographics education housing & living and health and safety. In hoursing and living it even specifies to taxes rent cars ownership commute time and commute transportation. It can allow us to pinpoint data from these cities and get detailed results
Description of How Data Was Collected: Data is collected from U.S Census and Amercan Community Survey

Title: US Census Los Gatos
Detailed Description of Data: This site from the US Census provides us detailed data about people income housing transporation education health and even business data
Description of How Data Was Collected: This data is gathered and provided by the U.S. Census

Title: This data is provided by Town Charts
Detailed Description of Data: The data here can be used to compare data in other cities also. The data includes: housing comparisons income comparisons rent costs utility cost and transportation cost
Description of How Data Was Collected: Data is collected by Town Charts and compares data from other cities also.

Agency: Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis Economic Data
Title: Current Population Survey
Detailed Description of Data: This data set includes economic data spanning decades and includes unemployment rates-earnings-labor force status flow-employment population ratio-labor force participation ratio-tax data
Description of How Data Was Collected: This data was collected from the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis which releases annualized economic data

Title: Municipal Code/Zoning Map/Land Use Map/GIS
Detailed Description of Data: This site offers zoning maps; zoning section of Municipal Code; and Land Use Map of the city of Cupertino
Description of How Data Was Collected: This data was collected by the City of Cupertino

Title: Database Tables and Calculators
Detailed Description of Data: The US Bureau of Labor Statics gathers data about labor throughout the United States and they provide an API to filter and download this data. Data includes consumer price index-productivity-employment projections
Description of How Data Was Collected: This data is available from the Bureau of Labor via an API.

Title: National Transit Database
Detailed Description of Data: The NTD was set up to be the repository of data about the financial operating and asset conditions of American transit systems
Description of How Data Was Collected: FTA grant recipients – those receiving funding from the Urbanized Area Formula Program (5307) or Rural Formula Program (5311) – are required to submit data to the NTD in uniform categories. More than 660 transit providers report to the NTD through the Internet-based system.

Title: Zoning and Land Use
Detailed Description of Data: This site provides links to zoning data for the City of Campbell and includes an interactive zoning map for Santa Clara County
Description of How Data Was Collected: Data was collected by the City of Campbell

Agency: Bureau of Economic Analysis - U.S. Department of Commerce
Title: Interactive Data Application: Regional Data: GDP & Personal Income Personal Income for San Jose-Sunnyvale-Santa Clara
Detailed Description of Data: Total Full-Time and Part-Time Employment by Industry
Description of How Data Was Collected: BEA collects source data conducts research and analysis develops and implements estimation methodologies and disseminates statistics to the public.

Title: Taxable Sales in California 2015
Detailed Description of Data: This website gives a list of taxes statewide by types of businesses; by county; by city
Description of How Data Was Collected: data was collected by the State of California
